title: Fringe Cuts
description: "The best acts from this year's Edinburgh Festival, brought together for one performance. Ross Noble introduces a selection of the finest songs, sketches and stand ups."

title: Ian Collins Unbranded
description:
16-minute interview segment on Ian Collins' late night talkSPORT show including his thoughts about the Perrier, 'mainstream comedy', taboo subjects, and Phoenix Nights.
"Flattered he did it with us and I remember him being superb."

title: One Way Single Parent Family Favourites
description:
Daniel Kitson and Richard Herring guest.
"The show went out on Sunday lunchtimes & featured an eclectic mix of music (largely from Stew's own personal collection) and at least one guest each week - often from the world of comedy."

title: The Conversation Hour
description: "Andrew Daddo's American roadtrip, and Daniel Kitson on stand-up comedy."

title: The Conversation Hour
description: ABC Radio Melbourne, show hosted by Jon Faine. Pam Creed was a guest along with Daniel Kitson.

title: Get This
description: Get This was an Australian radio comedy show which aired on Triple M hosted by Tony Martin and Ed Kavalee. A different guest co-host was featured nearly every day. Note that these complete shows come from the podcast and largely already have music removed.

title: Ben and the Old Man
description:
In 2007 Daniel Kitson offered a podcast feed on his website. It hosted a four-part recording of [Dancing](show:dancing)—his Edinburgh 2004 show—which would later be offered on Bandcamp, a clip from 2006's [Weltanschauung](show:weltanschauung) (which he would later release in full), and "various other bits and pieces."

*Ben and the Old Man* was a clip from 2005's [Stories for the Wobbly-Hearted](show:stories-for-the-wobbly-hearted), later released in its entirety on Vimeo in 2020.

title: Homeless Man on Tube
description:
In 2007 Daniel Kitson offered a podcast feed on his website. It hosted a four-part recording of [Dancing](show:dancing)—his Edinburgh 2004 show—which would later be offered on Bandcamp, a clip from 2006's [Weltanschauung](show:weltanschauung) (which he would later release in full), and "various other bits and pieces."

"this is a story about something that happened to me on the tube."

title: Me and Bob
description:
In 2007 Daniel Kitson offered a podcast feed on his website. It hosted a four-part recording of [Dancing](show:dancing)—his Edinburgh 2004 show—which would later be offered on Bandcamp, a clip from 2006's [Weltanschauung](show:weltanschauung) (which he would later release in full), and "various other bits and pieces."

Sometimes referred to online as *Roadside Drunk*, this was previously performed live in various forms as part of a preamble to [It's the Fireworks Talking](show:its-the-fireworks-talking).

title: Top Shelf
description: "Robbie Buck on Triple J gets a very unusual guest one afternoon, the wonderful Daniel Kitson, who has a bone or to to pick about things but is quite funny at times."

title: Artworks
description:
Artworks podcast from ABC Radio National presented by Amanda Smith. Edit includes the chat with "self-proclaimed professional comedy nerd" Dom Romeo and a ~10min interview with Kitson
"The award-winning UK comedian Daniel Kitson is in Australia with his latest show C-90. Daniel won the Perrier Award at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, and the Barry Award at the Comedy Festival in Melbourne, but he also does what he calls story shows, like C-90. It's about a man whose job it is to catalogue discarded old compilation tapes, no longer needed in the digital age.
C-90 recalls Henry Leonard Bodey's last day at work. Daniel Kitson is performing his solo show in Sydney's Opera House until the end of the month, then in October at Brisbane's Powerhouse before a season at the Melbourne International Arts Festival."

title: Get This
description: Get This was an Australian radio comedy show which aired on Triple M hosted by Tony Martin and Ed Kavalee. A different guest co-host was featured nearly every day. Note that these complete shows come from the podcast and largely already have music removed.

title: I Hate Myself and Want To Die
description:
In this ongoing series, Daz Chandler chats to an assortment of individuals ranging from comedians and musicians to novelists and politicians about their life as angst-ridden, pimple-picking teenagers. Just what type of teenager were they? And what stories and songs do they associate with that period of their lives? 'I Hate Myself and Want To Die' is a refreshingly unique insight into some of our most respected personalities.
In this episode, British comedian, Daniel Kitson, reveals what it was like to grow up in a quaint, English village with a sack-full of comedic ambitions and a notable absence of "tang".
Published on the hatemyselfchannel on YouTube, though it's unknown if this is the original source.

title: The Conversation Hour
description: "Jon Faine's co-host was comedian Tony Martin, as they talked sharks, death and Facebook with English comic Daniel Kitson."

title: Two Tones
description: "Daniel Kitson joins the 'Two Tones' today at one on the clock."

title: Versus - Judaism VS Australia
description: "1 hour (10am) 2 ideas battling for supremacy. 2 hunks (Nick Coyle and Eddie Sharp) Sometimes 1 special guest"

title: Lauren Laverne
description:
"Lauren welcomes comedian and poet Tim Key into the studio to talk about his [new show](show:tree) with Daniel Kitson. Plus New Music Monday, the MPFree and a boxful of great records."

Interview took place in the final hour of the three-hour show.

title: The Conversation Hour
description: "Their first guest is English comedian Daniel Kitson, a regular visitor to Australia during the Melbourne International Comedy Festival. This year he's involved in three projects: Not Yet But Soon – A Work In Progress Stand Up Show is at the Fairfax Studio, Arts Centre Melbourne now through to 16th April, 2017. [Stories for the Starlit Sky – A Trilogy](show:stories-for-the-starlit-sky) is presented with Gavin Osborn at the Playhouse, Arts Centre Melbourne now through to 23rd April, 2017. And [It’s Always Right Now Until It’s Later On – On Film](show:its-always-right-now-until-its-later) is screening at the Westgarth Cinema on Tuesday 18th & Wednesday 19th April, 2017 with Kitson introducing the film."

description:
Daniel returns to the airwaves after three years in a terrifyingly empty building, immediately battling flickering lights and a stopped clock.
Between playing tracks which make him want to smash chairs, he overshares about a salad-induced bathroom incident and realizes he’s timed his tea drinking poorly.

title: October 09, 2016
description:
Daniel recounts a trip to the American Embassy where he had to prove to a skeptical interviewer that he’s actually a comedian. He also deals with a "sound box" accidentally wolf-whistling in his bag while cycling and an awkward encounter with lost tourists where he dropped an egg while trying to help.
The night ends with him playing clips of other radio stations and ranting about a rude man at the London Film Festival.

title: October 16, 2016
description:
After realizing he played a whole song that no one could hear, Daniel shares a saga about his tooth collapsing while eating popcorn and requiring a Sunday dentist visit.
He describes riding his bike through a storm where he mistook lightning for a medical emergency and details his strict "kettle, wee, tea" routine. The show is a mix of dental trauma updates and waiting for his American passport to finally arrive.
